entries.message:
We are currently experiencing degraded network performance in multiple locations.

All customer servers and instances are online as normal, however their state may show as unknown and they may not be controllable from my.vultr.com or the API. Subscriptions are up and accessible on their normal IPs.

Our network engineers are actively working with to resolve the issue as quickly as possible.

Event Type: Object Storage Infrastructure Maintenance
Start Time: 2024-10-23 14:00:00 UTC
End Time: 2024-10-23 18:00:00 UTC

Our Cloud Storage team will be performing upgrades to our New Jersey Object Storage infrastructure. During this maintenance window, Object Storage subscriptions may be temporarily impacted for brief periods.

Event Type: Network Upgrade

We are performing system changes in the Chicago location during the following scheduled maintenance window. 

Start Time: 2024-10-22 05:00:00 UTC
End Time: 2024-10-22 09:00:00 UTC

We schedule higher impact maintenance events during off-peak times to reduce impact to customer infrastructure. Our engineers make every effort to minimize system impact, however, network reachability to Chicago instances may be affected for some, or all, of the scheduled maintenance window as we perform this work. While itâ€™s important to be aware of start and end times of the maintenance window, due to our redundant network architecture, our engineers expect that you may see little to no impact at all while the work is performed.

service_alerts.subject: Potential service disruption in Tel Aviv

entries.message:
The Constant Company, creator of Vultr, is aware of and following the situation in Israel. At this time we do not expect any disruption of service in our Tel Aviv location.  We will continue to closely monitor services as the situation evolves, and we will advise our customers of any changes which have the potential to impact service delivery.

We believe this is a crucial time to remind our customers about the importance of the 3-2-1 Backup Strategy for safeguarding all critical data. Please see the case study here for more information: https://www.vultr.com/docs/case-study-use-a-321-backup-strategy-at-vultr/

Please note that Vultr Snapshots and Backups are stored in the same location as the instance they are made from, however when you deploy a new instance from them in a different location, they will be automatically transferred and stored in the new location as well.
